title: Canyonlands National Park: Carmel Formation
body: Carmel Formation        The gentle slopes of the Carmel Formation near Horseshoe Canyon NPS/Cox       Deposited: Mid- to late-Jurassic (144 to 208 million years ago) Depositional Environment: Shallow marine and mud-flats Appearance: Mix of siltstone, shale and sandstone forms slopes Example: Some occurrence around the rim of Horseshoe Canyon makes this the youngest layer in Canyonlands. More prevalent along the Green River.         Rock Strata   Layer Above: Entrada Sandstone   Current Layer: Carmel Formation   Layer Below: Navajo Sandstone
